text: Spain's Prime Minister says regional
elections next month will help end what
he called the separatist havoc in
Catalonia Mariano Rajoy was addressing a
campaign event during his first visit
since imposing direct rule from a dread
of fortnight ago he urged those opposed
to Catalan independence to make sure
they vote from Barcelona the BBC's James
Reynolds sent this report Mariano Rajoy
came to visit the region he now runs
this was his first trip to Catalonia
since he deposed the local separatist
administration the first visit for a
while I asked him good he said this was
a busy campaign stop we want to bring
back the Catalonia that belongs to
everyone
with democracy and freedom we will
achieve this if the silent majority
turns out to voice their votes
[Applause]
for a short while at least the man who
ultimately rules catalonia is now here
in Catalonia Mariana laughs I want to
use this his visit to straighten the
flow Spain cap and this is what he is up
against on Saturday tens of thousands of
pro-independence campaigners took to the
streets we are people for the living
beasts where people who believe in
freedom with people will be living the
Republic and we will keep going on and
on and on but everything that will reach
our words it says the two halves of
Catalonia pro-independence and pro Spain
now begin a five-week campaign for their
future James Reynolds BBC News Barcelona
